alert.note: Alert for Arches, Grand Flat; Eastern Uinta Basin; Tavaputs Plateau (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 28 at 6:53AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW BAND... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow accompanied by winds of up to 50 MPH which will rapidly reduce visibility to less than one half of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 652 AM MST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Dinosaur to 42 miles east of Sunnyside and moving east at 35 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED... This band of heavy snow will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus, northwestern Grand Valley, southwestern Lower Yampa River Basin, west central Central Yampa River Basin, southeastern Eastern Uinta Basin, northeastern Arches/Grand Flat and northeastern Tavaputs Plateau Counties. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 1 and 42. Colorado 64 between mile markers 1 and 43. Colorado 139 between mile markers 42 and 72. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&

area.areaDesc: Arches, Grand Flat; Eastern Uinta Basin; Tavaputs Plateau
